summary: The video explains the origin story of the Brabus company, founded by Mr. Bushman. Initially, Mr. Bushman owned a Porsche 911 Turbo, which he parked in front of his parents' Mercedes shop. His father disapproved of the car, considering it inappropriate for someone from their social class, and insisted that Mr. Bushman sell it and replace it with an S-Class Mercedes-Benz. Dissatisfied with the performance and character of the S-Class, Mr. Bushman began modifying it to make it faster and more aggressive. As word spread about his modifications, others requested similar tuning services, leading to the establishment of Brabus. The name 'Brabus' is derived from combining the first three letters of Mr. Bushman's full name, 'Brakman Bushman.'
keywords: Brabus, Mr. Bushman, Porsche 911 Turbo, Mercedes shop, S-Class, tuning, adrenaline, performance, founder, Brakman Bushman
